level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-144
level.text: Law 11-144, the "Contribution Limitation Initiative Amendment Act of 1996," was introduced in Council and Assigned Bill No. 11-427, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 5, 1996, and April 2, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 18, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-261 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-144 became effective on June 13, 1996.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Applicability of chapter to Law 11-144: Section 4 of D.C. Law 11-144, the Contribution Limitation Initiative Amendment Act of 1996, provided that D.C. Code § 1-1101.01 et seq. shall apply to the act. D.C. Law 11-144 repeals § 1-1104.01 and amends §§ 1-1131.01, 1-1131.03, and 1-1104.02.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 3-1
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 3-1, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 1-1101.01.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Applicability of chapter to Law 11-144: Section 4 of D.C. Law 11-144, the Contribution Limitation Initiative Amendment Act of 1996, provided that D.C. Code § 1-1101.01 et seq. shall apply to the act. D.C. Law 11-144 repeals § 1-1104.01 and amends §§ 1-1131.01, 1-1131.03, and 1-1104.02.

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 day) repeal of section, see § 401(d) of Board of Ethics and Government Accountability Establishment and Comprehensive Ethics Reform Emergency Amendment Act of 2012 (D.C. Act 19-298, January 29, 2012, 59 DCR 683).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 1-27
level.text: Law 1-27 was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 1-90, which was referred to the Committee on Advisory Neighborhood Councils. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 17, 1975 and July 1, 1975, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 4, 1975, it was assigned Act No. 1-39 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 1-79
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 1-79, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 1-1101.01.

level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 1-126, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 1-1101.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 4-88
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 4-88, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 1-1101.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 7-66
level.text: Law 7-66 was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 7-153, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services and reassigned to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 13, 1987 and October 27, 1987, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on November 5, 1987, it was assigned Act No. 7-99 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 13-91
level.text: For Law 13-91, see notes following § 1-1102.05.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 16-305
level.text: For Law 16-305, see notes following § 1-307.02.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-52
level.text: Law 18-52, the "Citizen-Service Programs Amendment Act of 2009", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-105, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 2, 2009, and June 16, 2008, respectively. Enacted without signature by the Mayor on June 26, 2009, it was assigned Act No. 18-127 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-52 became effective on September 23, 2009.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-124
level.text: For history of Law 19-124, see notes under § 1-1101.
